node.title: Growing regulation causing added stress for dairy farmers - Survey
node.description: A new industry survey has found many dairy farmers are feeling under pressure, despite strong prices.

node.title: Farmers urged to create Covid-19 checklist
node.description: Farmers are being urged to create a check list on how to run their farm in case they get Covid-19 and can't do so themselves.

node.title: 'Revolution in nutrition': Fonterra hopes to boost health benefits of dairy products
node.description: Fonterra has announced a deal for the design of dairy products that incorporate targeted release of specific nutrients.

node.title: Some farmers out of step with more stringent winter grazing rules - report
node.description: Regional councils are taking winter grazing more seriously but there are still some farms not demonstrating good practice, a new report has found.

node.title: KiwiSaver third quarter returns relatively unaffected by lockdowns
node.description: KiwiSaver funds reflected subdued market conditions over the September quarter, with the bulk experiencing a return of less than one percent.

node.title: Westpac commits $300m to sustainable investments
node.description: The investment arm of Westpac Bank NZ is committing up to $300m to sustainable investments that adhere to strict global standards.

node.title: Xero offers free counselling to business owners: 'It's an incredibly tough time'
node.description: Xero is offering free counselling sessions to more than 200,000 small business owners in Auckland over the strain of more than 80 days lockdown.

node.title: Trustpower reports solid profit gain on higher electricity generation
node.description: Trustpower's first half profit increased as it produced more power at higher prices, and gained from a rise in the value of its electricity hedges.

node.title: Auckland farmers' markets wait for traffic light system before reopening
node.description: Two of Auckland's most popular farmers' markets will not be reopening next week, though they would be allowed to under level 3 step2.

node.title: Kiwibank owner calls time on life insurance business
node.description: The owner of Kiwibank has become the latest financial services provider to sell off its insurance business.

node.title: Government tells telecoms to hang up misleading marketing
node.description: The telecommunications sector has been told to clean up its marketing and selling tactics as the old copper line phone network and exchanges are dismantled.

node.title: $1.3m boost for study of erosion, sediment control measures in forestry sector
node.description: A seven-year forestry study aims to determine the most effective measures for reducing erosion and sediment in rivers from harvesting.

node.title: Auckland Covid-19 restrictions easing still leaves some businesses out in the cold
node.description: Some businesses are welcoming the news while others still unable to open aren't impressed with the rules under alert level 3 step 2. Audio

node.title: Air NZ to require vaccination or negative Covid-19 test for domestic flights
node.description: All passengers on Air New Zealand domestic flights will need to be fully vaccinated or have a negative Covid-19 test from mid-December. Audio

node.title: Deep-tech investment fund becomes first listing on Catalist capital market
node.description: A technology investment company will be the first listing on Catalist - the recently established capital market for small and medium-sized businesses.

node.title: First home buyers 'very active' in housing market
node.description: First home buyers' share of the property market has reached a record high, but it remains to be seen if the momentum can be sustained.

node.title: Armstrong's car dealers considering NZX and ASX listing
node.description: One of the country's biggest car dealers, Armstrong's, is considering listing on the New Zealand and Australian stock exchanges.
